body_text.text: as it ran out of a bed of sugar cane leaves in a field. Another was seen in a business office in Cuthbert.

12. Sylvilagus floridanus mallurus (Thomas). Eastern cottontail. I saw one cottontail along a roadside, and shot another in a garden where its presence was undesirable. ' 13. Sylvilagus aquaticus aquatlcus (Bachman). Swamp rabbit. Swamp' rabbits, probably of this form, and known locally as "swamp bucks," were said to frequent cane-brakes. The species has been taken at Lumpkin in the next county on the north (Nelson, N. A. Fauna No. 29, 1909, p. 273) .

14.0docoileus virginianus virginianus (Zimmermann). Virginia deer. Deer were reported on Pine Island, at the eastern boundary of the adj oining Calhoun County. Persons from Randolph County were said to go there nearly every year to hunt deer.-FRANCIS HARPER, Boston Society of Natural History, Boston, -Massachusetts.

In the August, 1928, number of the J OURNAL, vol. 9, p. 212, in my article "Additional Notes on the Life History of tqe Goss Lemming Mouse," the last sentence of the first paragraph should have been omitted. It reads, "As a source of life-history information, the article by Quick and Butler (Amer. Nat., vol. 19, pp. 113-118, 1885) RECENT LITERATURE

cite_spans.text: Quick and Butler (Amer. Nat., vol. 19, pp. 113-118, 1885)
